name: potato gnocchi

recipeInstructions.name: Bake Potatoes
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400Â°F, cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Cut open potatoes
recipeInstructions.text: Cut potatoes length-wise and let cool, this also removes more moisture from the potatoes. Add pot with water to stovetop and bring to boil.

recipeInstructions.name: Mash potatoes
recipeInstructions.text: Use potato ricer or masher to break up the potatoes, ideally you want them as smooth as possible for good texture. Add to large bowl.

recipeInstructions.name: Measure flour
recipeInstructions.text: Measure the flour on a digital scale for accuracy. Add in potato starch and xantham gum and mix together. Xantham gum will help the dough stick together.

recipeInstructions.name: Make Gnocchi
recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the flour into the mashed potato. Make sure everything is evenly mixed and split into 2 large round pieces and then again into 4 smaller pieces. You should have 8 dough balls. Start to take pieces off the dough and roll out into long cylinders, add some flour to the table to help with rolling. Cut the cylinders at every inch and roll on the back of a fork or with a gnocchi block.

recipeInstructions.name: Cook gnocchi
recipeInstructions.text: Take the gnocchi to the boiling water and drop in a couple at a time. Be careful not to crowd the pot. Once the gnocchi float to the top they are done! Add to sauce or saute in pan to brown and add crispyness or texture.

description: This recipe was deployed at a collab workshop dinner with Slow Food Philadelphia. This series of dinners explores simple and affordable food options local to Philly.
